issue.title: [R] All formats are supported with the lubridate `parse_date_time` binding
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16653](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Ensure:
- all formats supported and tested

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17555086) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
What formats do we currently not support?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17560114) by Dragoș Moldovan-Grünfeld (dragosmg):*
This depends on ARROW-16407. Once that one is merged, we can look into what formats we do not support.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17561048) by Rok Mihevc (rokm):*
We should investigate using formats [listed here](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/parse_date_time.html#details).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17561051) by Rok Mihevc (rokm):*
If we can support all formats we can remove the [supported formats list](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/8b298be4a3ebcf8655326e44a0d2ca6dd4eb254c/r/R/dplyr-datetime-helpers.R#L209-L217).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17571396) by Raúl Cumplido (raulcd):*
This is identified as one of the tickets required to create the first 9.0.0 RC, should this block the release?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17571399) by Dragoș Moldovan-Grünfeld (dragosmg):*
In my opinion, no, but `[~rokm]`  is the one working on it. It would be nice to have, but it's not a bug, more like an improvement.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17571404) by Raúl Cumplido (raulcd):*
Ok, I am moving it to 10.0.0 then. Feel free to move it back to 9.0.0 if it should be included and it's done before creating the RC

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16653?focusedCommentId=17572708) by Dewey Dunnington (paleolimbot):*
Issue resolved by pull request 13506
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13506>
